result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey R Hanneman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Reckless Probab./Great Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Supervised contact with child at agents discretion.

timeConds.notes: Huber.  Jail to start within 60 days

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

8:31 Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lambert does not oppose turning over medical records but there is Shifra and possible in-camera review.  Mother consents to release of medical records.  Atty Lambert plans on getting a release from Mom and will get the records from there.  Court orders that the records be released and that they be released to the father also.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 12, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
(Defendant)
from Atty. Gary J. Kryshak, dated September 23, 2014, re Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant Casey R Hanneman in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Kelly A. Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lehn amends address on Criminal Complaint.  Defendant stands mute and court enters a not guilty plea.  Bond continued.

1:47 Defendant Casey R Hanneman in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Kelly A. Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tammy Kubisiak is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to employment with Grand Rapids Police Dept.  Testifies to contact with Casey Hanneman 08/04/14 regarding injury to his son.  Injuries to child occurred on 07/19/14.  Testifies to location where injury to child took place.  Testifies to how she found out about injuries to the child.  Unsure at this time if child will sustain long term effects from injury.  Atty Kryshak stipulates to seating next to Casey Hanneman in the courtroom.

Atty Kryshak cross examines the witness.  Child was not seen by a doctor on 07/19/14 and no physical injuries were observed.  Was seen at Marshfield Clinic 3 or 4 days later.  Seizures followed the injuries on 2 separate occasions.  Testifies to individuals that were with the child prior to the marshfield visit.  Marshfield could not pinpoint an exact time of injury.

Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over for ARGN.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 22, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
